title: Inside Europe 11.08.2022
description: How Finland's radioactive waste should be safe for 100,000 years, the UK shuts its only gender identity clinic for children, and a Slovakian council digs in over the renaming of a street. Also: 30 years on, the victims of the war in Abkhazia still seek justice, Italian long-COVID sufferers learn how to smell again and meet the Edinburgh fringe comedian who performed to an audience of one.
itunes:author: DW.COM | Deutsche Welle
itunes:keywords: Inside Europe, Nik Martin, gender identity, Tavistock clinic, Ukraine war, Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, nuclear waste dump, French wine, Josef Tiso, puberty blockers, Georgia, Abkhazia, long COVID, sense of smell, sense of taste
